Article Title: Shilo Sanders’ bankruptcy scandal intensifies: NFL star accused of hiding $250K in NIL earnings as attorney slams flawed claims
Article Text:
Shilo Sanders faces $250K NIL transfer dispute amid bankruptcy case (Image via: Getty Images)

Shilo Sanders’ NIL earnings and legal issues under review





Shilo Sanders’ NFL career and bankruptcy case raise questions about NIL earnings





Shilo Sanders, the NFL free agent and son of legendary coach Deion Sanders, is at the center of a growing financial and legal storm. The former Colorado safety, who recently filed for Chapter 7 bankruptcy, is now accused of making unauthorized transfers totaling $250,000. The controversy revolves around money earned from his college football name, image, and likeness (NIL) deals, raising questions about compliance with bankruptcy law.The dispute has attracted significant media attention, as Shilo Sanders’ attorney strongly challenges the claims. Keri Riley, representing Sanders, insists the allegations are fundamentally flawed and argues that the funds in question were legitimately earned after the bankruptcy filing. According to Riley, the earnings, processed through companies created by Sanders, Big 21 LLC and Headache Gang LLC, should not be considered part of the bankruptcy estate.The trustee handling Sanders’ bankruptcy case claims the NFL player improperly transferred funds post-petition, potentially violating federal bankruptcy rules. These transfers, linked to Sanders’ NIL income during and after college, are now under legal review.Riley maintains that the money was generated legitimately and was separate from any pre-bankruptcy liabilities, emphasizing that Sanders’ NIL agreements are a modern revenue source increasingly used by college athletes.Adding complexity, Sanders faces a longstanding financial obligation stemming from a 2015 lawsuit. A former high school security guard in Dallas alleged Sanders caused injuries during an incident, and a default judgment of nearly $12 million was awarded. While Sanders filed for bankruptcy to manage this liability, the current allegations over NIL transfers complicate his path to financial resolution.Despite off-field challenges, Sanders briefly joined the Tampa Bay Buccaneers as an undrafted free agent. Reports indicate he signed a three-year contract worth roughly $2.97 million, although he earned just $1,572 in guaranteed money after being released during the preseason. His professional prospects now remain uncertain, with both legal and career questions looming.As this case unfolds, it highlights the intersection of bankruptcy law and modern NIL earnings, an emerging issue for athletes navigating financial and legal obligations. With Sanders’ attorney disputing the trustee’s claims, the outcome could set an important precedent for how post-bankruptcy NIL income is treated in the future.Also Read: “Never seen a call like that”: Dak Prescott slams referees after controversial penalty in Lions’ 44-30 win over Cowboys
Article Summary: Nfl free agent shilo sanders faces $250k nil transfer dispute amid bankruptcy case. Former colorado safety accused of making unauthorized transfers totaling $250,000. Controversy revolves around money earned from his college football name, image, and likeness (nil) deals.

Article Title: What did Nikita Hand reveal when Conor McGregor’s appeal was denied in her civil assault case
Article Text:
What did Nikita Hand reveal when Conor McGregor’s appeal was denied in her civil assault case (Image Via Getty)

Conor McGregor and James Lawrence denied appeal as Nikita Hand responds

Nikita Hand has spoken out after the Supreme Court in Dublin refused to hear the appeals of Conor McGregor and James Lawrence in her long-running civil case. The decision was announced on Thursday, when the court confirmed that both men would not be allowed to challenge earlier rulings made in the High Court. The civil case began after an incident that took place in December 2018 at a hotel in south Dublin.Last year, Nikita Hand, also known as Nikita Ní Laimhín won her civil action and was awarded nearly €250,000 in damages. She also received a ruling that Conor McGregor must cover about €1.3 million in legal costs. After Thursday’s update, Hand posted on social media, saying she is relieved that this part of the process is over and grateful for the support she received throughout the case.The Supreme Court ruling came on Thursday morning in Dublin. The judges stated that Conor McGregor “had a fair hearing” during the original trial and found no reason to allow his appeal.McGregor’s appeal request focused on questions he was asked in court about his “no comment” answers during a Garda interview.The court looked at that claim and rejected it, stating the trial judge acted within legal rules. James Lawrence, who was also part of the original case, was not found liable for assault by the jury in the civil trial.However, the trial judge had ruled that Nikita Hand did not have to pay his legal costs. Lawrence appealed that decision, but the Supreme Court judges also rejected his request, saying the lower court followed “well-established principles.”After the ruling, Nikita Hand shared a short message online. She wrote that she was “thankful this step is now closed” and that she hopes to continue moving forward.Her message was posted shortly after news outlets in Dublin published the decision. In the High Court Nikita Hand received €214,994 in damages last year at the termination of the original case.In December 2018 at a hotel in south Dublin, the event central of the case took place.During the civil case, the jury heard extensive evidence; the ultimate decision demanded McGregor to pay the damages as well as about €1.3 million in legal expenses.The Supreme Court's ruling marks the most recent update in a years-long case. Since both appeals were rejected, the rulings of the High Court still stand in whole.Also Read: Joe Rogan Claims Jesus May Come Back As Artificial Intelligence And Sends Social Media Into Debate
Article Summary: Conor mcgregor and james lawrence denied appeal in civil assault case. Nikita hand, also known as nikita ní laimhín won her civil action and was awarded nearly €250,000 in damages. She also received a ruling that conor mcgregor must cover about €1.3 million in legal costs.

Article Title: Hyderabad Road Rename: Hyderabad govt decides to rename road after US President Donald Trump
Article Text:
Telangana plans to rename US consulate road as ‘Donald Trump Avenue’

HYDERABAD: The state govt has decided to name several roads in the city after US President Donald Trump, Ratan Tata, Google, Microsoft, Wipro, among others. According to the CMO, the road along the United States consulate general in Hyderabad is set to be called ‘Donald Trump Avenue'.The upcoming greenfield radial road connecting the ORR at Raviryal with the proposed RRR will be named after Ratan Tata, with the interchange at Raviryal already named ‘Tata Interchange'.The govt will write to the Union external affairs ministry and the US embassy, informing them about the plans. Earlier this year, the chief minister, while addressing the annual US-India Strategic Partnership Forum (USISPF) conclave in New Delhi, had proposed naming key roads in Hyderabad after leading global corporations.Additionally, a prominent stretch will be named ‘Google Street' in recognition of the global impact and contribution of Google Maps and the corporation at large.The road alongside its upcoming campus, set to be Google's largest campus outside the US, will bear this name. These proposals are part of the govt's initiative to position the state as a symbol of innovation-driven India, the CMO said.Microsoft and Wipro are also likely to find representation on the city's topography, with proposals for a Wipro Junction and a Microsoft Road, in line with the Chief Minister's vision. The govt is further considering dedicating additional roads in honour of distinguished individuals and major corporations.
Article Summary: Telangana plans to rename us consulate road as ‘donald trump avenue’ a prominent stretch will be named ‘google street’ in recognition of the global impact and contribution of google maps. The road alongside its upcoming campus, set to be google's largest campus outside the us, will bear this name.
